title: Welfare Act 2020 (No. 30 of 2020)), and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation–

2. These Regulations come into operation–

(b) 

in so far as they relate to blind pension, on 6 January 2023.

title: Welfare Act 2020 (No. 30 of 2020)), and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 412 of 2007) are amended by the substitution of the 
following article for article 33 (amended by article 3 of the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) (Amendment) (No.1) 
(Earnings Disregard) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 401 of 2022)): 

“Earnings disregard — certain supplementary welfare allowance 
supplements
text_norm: 3 social welfare (consolidated supplementary welfare allowance regulation 2007 (s.i no 412 2007) amended substitution following article article 33 (amended article 3 social welfare (consolidated supplementary welfare allowance) (amendment) (no.1) (earnings disregard) regulation 2022 (s.i no 401 2022)) earnings disregard -- certain supplementary welfare allowance supplement

title: Welfare Act 2020 (No. 30 of 2020)), and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule
heading: 33. In assessing the means of a person for the purposes of Rule
text_raw:
33. In assessing the means of a person for the purposes of Rule 
1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3 to the Principal Act, the amount to be 
disregarded in respect of earnings received by that person from 
employment shall be the first €165.00 of such weekly earnings.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 3rd January, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [723] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 December, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection.

title: Welfare Act 2020 (No. 30 of 2020)), and Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Budget 23 provided for an increase of €25 (from €140 to €165) in the weekly 
earnings disregard for claimants of Disability Allowance or Blind Pension. The 
Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) 
(No. 15) (Earnings Disregard) (S.I. No. 614 of 2022) provides for this increase. 

Where the earnings disregard is availed of by a claimant of Disability 
Allowance or Blind Pension, Rule 1(2)(b)(iv) of Part 4 of Schedule 3 of the 
Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 provides that the disregard will also be 
taken into account in determining their entitlement to supplements, such as 
Rent Supplement, under the Supplementary Welfare Allowance (SWA) 
Scheme. 

These Regulations substitute article 33 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007, to provide that for the 
purposes of Supplementary Welfare Allowance, the current weekly earnings 
disregard for Disability Allowance and Blind Pension claimants, is increased 
from €140 to €165. The new weekly earnings disregard applies from 4 January 
2023 in the case of Disability Allowance and from 6 January 2023 in the case 
of Blind Pension.
